abstract.para: The &dapslong; can be installed and used on any Linux distribution. Because &dapsacr; was originally developed by the SUSE documentation team for managing their documentation projects, it is available as RPM package for the &osuse; distribution (and the &sle; products based on &osuse;). Eventually, RPM packages for further distributions may become available. taroth 2012-02-07: taroth: the following is WIP - In the meantime, you can download a tarball with the &dapsacr; sources and install them on any distribution with automake.

sect1.title: Installing &dapsacr; on &osuse;
sect1.para: For basic details on how to add software repositories and how to install software on &osuse;, refer to the &osuse; Reference Guide. The guide is available as part of the &osuse; documentation from .
Choose one of the following installation methods:

listitem.para: Follow the instructions in the &osuse; Reference Guide, chapter Installing Packages from the Internet. Search for the package daps that matches your &osuse; version. From the list of results, install the one that is provided by the repository Documentation:Tools.

sect1.para: All of the installation methods mentioned above will take care of resolving any dependencies to other packages that are required by &dapsacr;. If all requirements can be fulfilled, &dapsacr; will be successfully installed in your system and is ready to use.
